document_name_accent: viem tai giua thung mang nhi.json
document_title: Otitis media with perforated eardrum: Is it dangerous and how to treat it?
subsection_name: viem-tai-giua-thung-mang-nhi.json_3_Signs of chronic otitis media with perforated eardrum
subsection_content:
Dr. Huong said that common signs of chronic otitis media with perforated eardrum include:
Perforated eardrum lasting more than 12 weeks;; Ear discharge, foul-smelling ear;; Tinnitus;(2); Conductive hearing loss;; Middle ear mucosa edema and degeneration;; Pain symptoms are not common;; In children, the above symptoms can lead to children reacting poorly to sounds due to hearing loss and poor balance.
Image of otitis media with perforated eardrum
